brief: Helper class for a list of Strings

methods.name: size()
methods.desc: Get the length of the list

methods.name: clear()
methods.desc: Remove all entries from the list

methods.name: get()
methods.desc: Get an entry at a particular index

methods.name: set()
methods.desc: Set an entry at a particular index

methods.name: remove()
methods.desc: Remove an element from the specified index

methods.name: append()
methods.desc: Add a new entry to the list

methods.name: hasValue()
methods.desc: Check if a value is a part of the list

methods.name: reverse()
methods.desc: Reverse the order of the list

methods.name: shuffle()
methods.desc: Randomize the order of the list elements

methods.name: lower()
methods.desc: Make the entire list lower case

methods.name: upper()
methods.desc: Make the entire list upper case

methods.name: toArray()
methods.desc: Create a new array with a copy of all the values

description: Helper class for a list of String objects. Lists are designed to have some features of ArrayList, but to maintain the simplicity and efficiency of working with arrays. Functions such as sort() and shuffle() always act on the list itself. To get a sorted copy, use list.copy().sort().
name: StringList
